etymologies: mid 18th century. From Pulicat (Tamil Paḻaverkāṭu), the name of a town on the northern coast of Tamilnadu

definitions: In singular and plural. A type of coloured material, a length of this, or a coloured handkerchief made from this, originally from Pulicat; (hence) a material made in imitation of these, woven from dyed yarn.
